meanings.definition: The state or quality of being holy.
meanings.sent1: Her holinesse shone through in her kind actions towards others.
meanings.sent2: The holinesse of the church was evident in the peaceful atmosphere within its walls.
meanings.sent3: The holinesse of the old book was so great that it seemed to glow on the shelf.
meanings.sent4: The holinesse of the moment was palpable, as if time itself had stopped to honor it.
meanings.sent5: The holinesse of the ancient tree filled the forest with a sense of reverence and awe.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being dedicated or consecrated to God or a religious purpose.
meanings.sent1: The holinesse of the ceremony brought tears to the eyes of the faithful.
meanings.sent2: In the monastery, the holinesse of the rituals was observed with utmost reverence.
meanings.sent3: The holinesse of the sacred relic was so revered that pilgrims traveled from afar to see it.
meanings.sent4: The holinesse of the temple seemed to radiate a divine light that touched all who entered.
meanings.sent5: The holinesse of the prayer echoed through the quiet chapel, filling the hearts of the worshippers with peace.
